tllachenpa: Mostly what your mind wants is conditioned in to you by the society. So if you think freedom is doing what your mind wants to then it's no freedom at all because your mind is terribly brainwashed since you were born. You might think you are free but you are living under illusion. Freedom is not about doing what your mind or body wants you to do but freedom means to be free from the mind and it's dictates. To be able to use it when you need to use it and to keep it aside when there's no need of it. To flow like water and take whatever shape it is put in, spontaneously and peacefully and not be like wood, fixed and rigid, adhering to a fixed idea be it conservatism or modernism which only breeds violence. Freedom is being free from the mind and it's reptilian urges be it about wanting to showing skin or boozing at 1:am. Freedom is not about being able to do whatever your animal inherited mind wants to disregarding everything else but it is about being a sensible, rational person who goes about his life smoothly. This is true rebellion and not the one which you advocate. True rebellion is being able to live peacefully amidst a sea of contradicting cultures. Freedom is internal. Giving in to every urge of your mind is no freedom at all, rather it is being a slave to it. Freedom is to have power over these urges and not let these urges overpower you.

wordsthatineversaid: Stop body shaming ❌ What is the first thing that crosses our mind when we say ‘body’? Colour, shape, size, curves, sexy, ugly and hundreds of others adjectives that appear gaudy.  We’d all be lying if we said identity, individualism, personality,  But the truth lies in the lie itself, that’s reality.  Your Body is Yours ONLY. It has singular ownership.  It’s what makes you different from everyone else, so why do you want to try and make someone else the captain of your own ship?  You’re the creator and the destroyer of your own storms.  Why do you want to lose that ownership and dilute yourself in a sea of stereotypes and socially acceptable norms?  People associate body with beauty too, not realizing that beauty surpasses the colour, shape and size of the body, it’s much deeper;  It’s analogous to the treasure that drowns in an ocean. It’s always found on the sea bed, shining brightest, a keeper. Beauty pageants are slowly modifying the definition of beauty, embracing real beauty instead of external appearances, if you think you are comfortable in your own skin,  Exult confidence and self-esteem in whatever you do and say, and you are the epitome of beauty. You are worthy of winning every beauty pageant there is to win.  Make your body yours only. Start rejoicing your individuality, be the person you were when you took birth;  Raw and pure, be yourself, be beautiful, know your worth. Follow @wordsthatineversaid for more!
